LanguageData.LetterText_ShamblerGorehulk: Be careful, the group contains a shambler gorehulk.
LanguageData.LetterText_ShamblerGorehulkPlural: Be careful, the group contains several shambler gorehulks.
LanguageData.LetterText_ShamblerChimera: Be careful, the group contains a shambler chimera.
LanguageData.LetterText_ShamblerChimeraPlural: Be careful, the group contains several shambler chimeras.
LanguageData.LetterRevenantRevealedFirst: Привид з'явився і переслідує одного з ваших колоністів!
LanguageData.LetterRevenantSmearDiscovered: {0} has noticed a black slick on the ground. It looks unnatural and gives off a foul, acrid smell. It is still fresh and wet. An eldritch entity passed by recently.
LanguageData.LetterRevenantKilled: Привид мертвий! Those who were hypnotized will recover.\n\nIts body has dissipated, leaving behind its spine. You can gather and study the spine, or destroy it.
LanguageData.LetterPawnHypnotized:
{PAWN_nameDef} був гіпнотизований привидом і тепер нерозбірливо бурмоче про лячні образи та ідеї.

Вбивство привида припинить гіпноз.

Привид використовує психічні сили, щоб маніпулювати сприйняттям тих хто поруч, роблячи себе невидимим. However, it can still be hunted by following the black smears that it leaves. The revenant will be revealed if hit by explosive weapons, firefoam, EMPs, fire, or disruptor flares.

If not killed, the revenant will continue to hypnotize new victims.
LanguageData.LetterRevenantFleshChunkText: Поранений ревенант залишив шматок себе. Ви можете проаналізувати цей шматок м'яса, щоб дізнатися, як відстежувати ревенанта.
LanguageData.LetterRevenantEmergence: Ревенант знову з'явився з безпеки своєї хребта! Destroy it before it escapes.\n\nIn the process, the revenant has mutated and adopted a new biosignature.
LanguageData.LetterSightstealerRevealed: A twisted creature has appeared out of thin air!
LanguageData.LetterSightstealerHowl: Your colonists hear sightstealers shrieking in the distance.\n\nIt's hard to tell where they are or how many. They might arrive immediately or days from now.
LanguageData.LetterSightstealerHowlBig: Your colonists hear a huge number of distant sightstealers screaming in their twisted rage. They are coming.\n\nThey might arrive immediately, or days from now.
LanguageData.LetterDeathPallEnded: The pall of death is lifting. The corpses reanimated by it will soon return to their natural state.
LanguageData.LetterGateClosing: The pit gate is closing! Its entrance is about to crumble.\n\nThe pit gate entrance was unstable from the start and is finally sealing itself.
LanguageData.MustPlaceNextToPitGate: Must be placed adjacent to a pit gate.
LanguageData.EmergenceWarningText: The ground shakes under your feet and the inhuman screams echoing from the pit seem to get closer. Something will emerge soon.
LanguageData.LetterGateEntered:
In the depths of the pit gate, you have discovered a massive cavern system infested with fleshbeasts.

The cavern system is clogged with masses of living flesh that block your progress. Attack the fleshmass to destroy it.

The entire cavern system seems unstable. If you find what lies behind the fleshmass, you may be able to collapse the tunnels and close the pit gate.
LanguageData.LetterDreadmeldWarning: As {PAWN_nameDef} draws near the fleshmass here, {PAWN_pronoun} senses a heavy writhing and throbbing from under its warm surface. Some huge living entity is hidden behind the wall of flesh.
LanguageData.LetterUndercaveCollapsing: The dreadmeld's death has shocked the fleshmass and caused the cave system to destabilize. The fleshmass that supported the cavern is already beginning to deteriorate. Протягом половини дня вся печера обвалиться.\n\nВиберіться з підземення поки не пізно!
LanguageData.RemoveFromPlatformDesc: Remove the current entity held on the platform.
LanguageData.MutatorObeliskLetter: The obelisk is activating! It swells with grisly energy as the air crackles around it. It is about to self-destruct in a great explosion, but before it does, it will use its hideous transformative power on any creature it can detect.
LanguageData.ObeliskTentacleLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt {PAWN_possessive} arm tingling. Moments later, {PAWN_possessive} skin split open as a fleshy growth erupted from {PAWN_possessive} body. {PAWN_possessive} arm has been replaced by a squirming tentacle!\n\n{PAWN_nameDef} lost some blood, but seems otherwise unharmed.
LanguageData.ObeliskFleshWhipLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt {PAWN_possessive} arm tingling. Moments later, {PAWN_possessive} skin split open violently as a growth burst from {PAWN_possessive} body. {PAWN_possessive} arm has been replaced by a tentacle tipped with a bony blade!\n\n{PAWN_nameDef} lost some blood, but seems otherwise unharmed by this disturbing event. The tentacle is hideous, but it will make an excellent melee weapon.
LanguageData.MutatorObeliskFailedArmLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt {PAWN_possessive} arm tingling for a few moments. The feeling passed.\n\nThe obelisk tried to mutate {PAWN_nameDef} but failed.
LanguageData.ObeliskFleshmassStomachLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt a sudden sharp pain in {PAWN_possessive} stomach, as {PAWN_possessive} tissue began to roil and mutate. {PAWN_possessive} stomach has mutated into a mass of semi-sentient flesh. The harsh acids it produces are painful but prevent food poisoning.
LanguageData.MutatorObeliskFailedStomachLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt {PAWN_possessive} stomach aching for a few moments. The feeling passed.\n\nThe obelisk tried to mutate {PAWN_nameDef} but failed.
LanguageData.ObeliskFleshmassLungLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt a sudden sharp pain in {PAWN_possessive} chest, as {PAWN_possessive} lung began to twist and swell. {PAWN_possessive} lung has mutated into a painful mass of semi-sentient flesh. The tissue is constantly regrowing and replacing itself, making it immune to effects like lung rot and asthma.
LanguageData.MutatorObeliskFailedLungLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} felt {PAWN_possessive} chest ache for a few moments. The feeling passed.\n\nThe obelisk tried to mutate {PAWN_nameDef} but failed.
LanguageData.ObeliskAnimalMutationLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} observed a sudden spike in energy. The obelisk has violently warped the flesh of {ANIMAL}, turning it into a hideous fleshbeast.
LanguageData.ObeliskTreeMutationLetter: While interacting with the obelisk, {PAWN_nameDef} observed a sudden pulse of energy. The obelisk has twisted a nearby tree into a harbinger tree. These monstrous trees are capable of feeding on nearby corpses and raw meat.
LanguageData.ObeliskDuplicationLetter: While {PAWN_nameDef} interacted with the obelisk, it pulsed with energy and generated a flash of light. {PAWN_nameDef} found {PAWN_objective}self face to face with a copy of {PAWN_objective}self! The duplicate claims to be the real {PAWN_nameDef} and has joined your colony.
LanguageData.ObeliskDuplicationFailedLetter: {PAWN_nameDef} attempted to trigger the obelisk but nothing occurred. Something about {PAWN_nameDef} is preventing the obelisk from duplicating {PAWN_objective}.
LanguageData.ObeliskHostileDuplicateLetter: While {PAWN_nameDef} interacted with the obelisk, it pulsed with energy and generated a flash of light. {PAWN_nameDef} found {PAWN_objective}self face to face with a copy of {PAWN_objective}self. The duplicate is approaching {PAWN_nameDef} with murderous intent!
LanguageData.DuplicatorObeliskLetter: The obelisk is activating! The air around it crackles with energy. Duplicates of your colonists will soon appear with murderous intent.\n\nBe careful - unstable energy is coursing through the obelisk and it could explode at any moment.
LanguageData.ObeliskAbductorLetter: The warped obelisk crackles with energy as it warps space around itself. All manner of creatures are beginning to disappear and will soon vanish entirely.\n\nBe careful - unstable energy is coursing through the obelisk and it could explode at any moment.
LanguageData.ObeliskAbductedDisappearingLetter: {PAWN_nameDef} noticed activity in the warped obelisk. Some mysterious internal mechanism has come to life, causing {PAWN_nameDef} to begin to disappear. {PAWN_pronoun} will soon vanish entirely.
LanguageData.ObeliskAbductedLetter:
{PAWN_nameDef} has been teleported to a strange room. The walls are an unidentifiable gray material and the air is dead still. {PAWN_pronoun} doesn't know where {PAWN_pronoun} is - or how to get home.

A nearby door is jammed but looks like it can be forced open with some effort. Right-click jammed doors to open them.

By studying the obelisk, other colonists may be able to understand what happened to {PAWN_nameDef} and find a way to help {PAWN_objective}. Alternatively, attacking the obelisk may provoke it to abduct more colonists.
LanguageData.MutatorObeliskSpawned: A fleshbeast has emerged from the ground.
LanguageData.ObeliskActivateDescWarning: Warning: The warped obelisk is unstable. Fully activating it will provoke a dangerous response and will cause the obelisk to self-destruct.
LanguageData.ActivitySuppressionTooltipDisabled: Automatic suppression is currently disabled. Enable it to have wardens suppress the {PAWN_labelShort}.
LanguageData.ActivitySuppressionTooltipDesc:
The {0}'s activity level rises over time. Activity rises faster if the {0} is damaged or provoked.

If the activity level reaches 100%, the {0} will activate.

Wardens can suppress the {0} to keep its activity at a safe level. They will suppress it any time its activity is above the assigned level: {LEVEL}

Entities that have higher activity levels will give more knowledge when studied.
LanguageData.ActivitySuppressionToggleTooltipDesc: This determines whether the {PAWN_labelShort} will be automatically suppressed when its activity is above {LEVEL}.\n\nAutomatic suppression is currently {ONOFF}.
LanguageData.CaptureEntityDesc: Capture {0_definite}. It must be restrained on a holding platform. Once restrained, it can be studied.
LanguageData.NoActiveResearchProject: No active anomaly research project selected for {0} knowledge category.
LanguageData.RequiresHoldingPlatform: Must be captured in a holding platform.
LanguageData.ChooseNociosphereDest: Choose a location for the nociosphere to teleport to.
LanguageData.TransferEntityDesc: Transfer the contained entity to another holding platform.
LanguageData.CancelTransferDesc: Cancel transferring this entity to another holding platform.
LanguageData.ImplantSourceUnknown: Implanted before arrival at your colony
LanguageData.FoodImplant: Implanted through a meal cooked by {SOURCE_nameDef}
LanguageData.FeedingImplant: Implanted when fed a meal by {SOURCE_nameDef}
LanguageData.MetalhorrorEmergingDesc: A metalhorror is emerging! Slicing through flesh and skin, this nightmarish bladed creature is cutting its way out of its host. The metalhorror is emerging from:
LanguageData.MetalhorrorEmergingPluralDesc: Metalhorrors are emerging! Slicing through flesh and skin, these nightmarish bladed creatures are cutting their way out of their hosts. Metalhorrors are emerging from:
LanguageData.MetalhorrorEmergingDescAppended: These horrifying metallic parasites live inside the victim, taking control of higher reasoning via a network of hair-thin metallic filaments that they spread throughout the body and brain. They control the victim's mind and compel them to infect others with new metalhorrors.
LanguageData.MetalhorrorSurgicalInspectionDetails: These doctors were infested and controlled by metalhorrors, so they lied about the results of a surgical inspection
LanguageData.MetalhorrorReasonInteraction: {INFECTED_nameDef}'s metalhorror emerged because it was discovered by {PAWN_nameDef} during a social interaction.
LanguageData.MetalhorrorReasonInterrogation: {INFECTED_nameDef}'s metalhorror emerged because it was discovered by {PAWN_nameDef} during an interrogation.
LanguageData.MetalhorrorReasonSurgeryInspected: {INFECTED_nameDef}'s metalhorror emerged because it was detected by {PAWN_nameDef} during a surgical inspection.
LanguageData.MetalhorrorReasonTriedToLeaveMap: {INFECTED_nameDef}'s metalhorror emerged upon sensing it was being taken away from the colony.
LanguageData.InteractionDetectedDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} noticed something wrong with {INFECTED_nameDef} while chatting. {INFECTED_nameDef} exhibited some combination of unnatural behavior, strange vocal sounds, or barely visible metallic worms in the eyes. {PAWN_nameDef} suspects that {INFECTED_nameDef} is infected with a metalhorror.
LanguageData.InterrogationDetectedDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} has found something unusual while interrogating {INFECTED_nameDef}. {INFECTED_nameDef} exhibited some combination of unnatural behavior, strange vocal sounds, or barely visible metallic worms in the eyes. {PAWN_nameDef} suspects that {INFECTED_nameDef} is infected with a metalhorror.
LanguageData.MetalhorrorNoticedDetailsAppended:
Metalhorrors are parasites that control the host and use {INFECTED_objective} to infect others.

Metalhorrors grow stronger inside the host as time passes. A metalhorror will cut its way out of the host's body if it knows it's been detected. The process is horrifying, but the host generally survives.

The only way to confirm a person is infected with a metalhorror is to study the metalhorror's fleshy leavings to identify its biosignature, then use the surgical inspection operation with a trusted doctor.

Once discovered, you can use the surgical inspection operation to cause a metalhorror to emerge from its host. Be prepared for a fight.
LanguageData.LetterGrayFleshDiscovered:
{PAWN_nameDef} has discovered a strip of fleshy tissue. It resembles human skin stained gray by tiny metallic particles. It must have sloughed off someone during flesh liquification.

Someone here may not be what they seem.

There are several ways to detect imposters:

{METHODS}

Warning: Some parasites can control the mind and even be transmitted to others.
LanguageData.LetterInterrogationUnlocked: The “interrogate” prisoner interaction mode is now unlocked.
LanguageData.LetterGrayFleshMethodOne: Imprison someone and send a warden to interrogate them about their true identity. This can take many days.
LanguageData.LetterGrayFleshMethodTwo: Collect more gray flesh and analyze it to determine the biosignature of the threat. Then, use the surgical inspection operation to search for that biosignature. It could take a long time to collect enough samples, and the surgery is invasive.
LanguageData.LetterGrayFleshMethodThree: Execute or banish whoever you suspect.
LanguageData.LetterMetalhorrorReawakening: The metalhorrors have been disturbed and are awakening again!
LanguageData.MessageMetalHorrorDormant: The metalhorrors are beginning to hibernate. They will awaken again if disturbed.
LanguageData.LetterSurgicallyInspectedHeader: {DOCTOR_nameDef} performed an extensive surgical inspection of {PATIENT_nameDef}.
LanguageData.LetterSurgicallyInspectedNothing: {DOCTOR_pronoun} says that {DOCTOR_pronoun} found no anomalies. However, a doctor may lie if it is in their own self-interest.
LanguageData.HarbingerTreeSprouted: A new harbinger tree has sprouted.
LanguageData.HarbingerTreeNotConsuming: Will consume corpses and meat placed nearby.
LanguageData.CreateCorpseStockpileDesc: Create a dumping stockpile zone around the harbinger tree for corpses.\n\nHarbinger trees will consume nearby corpses and raw meat. If well fed, the trees will grow faster and create new harbinger trees.
LanguageData.LetterCreeperAppearedAppended: {PAWN_pronoun} wants to talk. You can send a colonist to hear what {PAWN_pronoun} has to say.
LanguageData.LetterCreeperInviteAppend: {PAWN_pronoun} may be very useful, but you also sense there is something {PAWN_nameDef} is not telling you.
LanguageData.LetterUnnaturalHealingTentacle: However, something went terribly wrong.\n\n{PAWN_nameDef}'s arm split open as a violent growth emerged from {PAWN_possessive} body. {PAWN_possessive} arm has been replaced by a fleshy tentacle!
LanguageData.ElectroharvesterNoPlatform: Not connected to a holding platform.
LanguageData.FleshmassHeartInvulnerable: Невразливе. Analyze fleshmass neural lumps to destroy this.
LanguageData.FleshmassHeartCollecting: Collecting biomass for next growth spurt...
LanguageData.LetterFleshmassHeartDestroyed: The fleshmass heart has been destroyed, leaving behind a broken but still functional core - a twisted amalgam of flesh and archotechnology. The nucleus continues to grow and mutate flesh, even while the surrounding fleshmass decays.\n\nYou can capture the nucleus to study it further or destroy it to end this nightmare. If left alone, it may reform into a new fleshmass heart.
LanguageData.NerveBundleGrewMessage: The fleshmass heart has grown a new nerve bundle.
LanguageData.NeuralLumpDroppedMessage: The nerve bundle has dropped a neural lump. Analyze it to learn more about the fleshmass heart.
LanguageData.DestroyHeartDisabled: Must collect and analyze fleshmass neural lumps. Lumps analyzed
LanguageData.ActiveFleshmassInspect: Активна м'ясна маса. May birth fleshbeasts if destroyed.
LanguageData.LetterFleshTentacleAttack: {PAWN_nameDef}'s operation was successful. However, the twisting mass of flesh that was {PAWN_possessive} tentacle has begun to attack!
LanguageData.MessageShardDropped: {0} dropped a shard of dark archotechnology. You can collect and make use of it.
LanguageData.Berserk_BloodRain: The blood rain has driven {0} into a berserk rage!
LanguageData.Manhunter_BloodRain: The blood rain has driven {0} into a manhunting rage!
LanguageData.MentalBreakReason_BloodRage: This happened because of blood rage buildup.
LanguageData.LetterCorpseReappeared: The corpse resembling {PAWN_nameDef} has appeared again, as if out of thin air.
LanguageData.MessageCorpseEscaped: The corpse resembling {PAWN_nameDef} has somehow gotten out of its {CONTAINER_labelShort}.
LanguageData.MessageUnnaturalCorpseResurrect: Failed to resurrect {PAWN_nameDef}. It simply does not respond.
LanguageData.MessagePawnFainted: The unnatural corpse has caused {PAWN_nameDef} to faint.
LanguageData.MessageAwokenReappeared: The unnatural corpse has appeared near {PAWN_nameDef} and is approaching!
LanguageData.MessageAwokenVanished: The unnatural corpse has vanished. It will come for {PAWN_nameDef} later.
LanguageData.MessageAwokenKilledVictim: The awoken corpse has destroyed {PAWN_nameDef}'s brain.
LanguageData.MentalBreakReason_MysteriousCorpse: This happened because of the presence of an unnatural corpse.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseStudyLetterDesc:
Your investigation of the unnatural corpse has revealed more about the body. An archotech shard at its core psychically links it with {VICTIM_nameDef}. It will rebuild itself if destroyed, and teleport any distance to be near {VICTIM_nameDef}. 

{RESEARCHER_nameDef} thinks that there may be a way to permanently destroy the corpse but will need to study it further.

Study the corpse more to learn how to destroy it.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseStudyCompletedLetterDesc: Your investigation of the unnatural corpse has revealed how to safely remove the archotech shard. Doing so will stop it from psychically tormenting {VICTIM_nameDef}. However, it will also prevent further study of the corpse.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseDeactivatedLetterDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} extracted an archotech shard from the unnatural corpse, the corpse then began to violently bloat and exploded into gore.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseAwakeningLetterDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} feels the unnatural corpse growing rapidly stronger. Some horrible consciousness is flickering within it.\n\nSomething awful will happen in the next few days.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseAwakeningLetterExtra_Stud: Destroy the corpse before it's too late.
Study the corpse to learn how to destroy it.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseAwokenLetterDesc:
The unnatural corpse is rising! It intends to attack {PAWN_nameDef}!

The corpse will follow {PAWN_nameDef} forever no matter how far {PAWN_pronoun} goes.

You must destroy it now.
LanguageData.UnnaturalCorpseAwokenDefeatedLetterDesc: The unnatural corpse charging towards {PAWN_nameDef} has been defeated!\n\nThe corpse will no longer torment {PAWN_nameDef}.
LanguageData.MessageGoldenCubeSeverityIncreased: {PAWN_labelShort}'s obsession with the golden cube has intensified.
LanguageData.MessageGoldenCubeInterest: {PAWN_labelShort} has become intrigued by the golden cube.
LanguageData.MessageGoldenCubeSculptureDestroyed: {PAWN_labelShort} is enraged that {PAWN_possessive} cube sculpture was removed. {PAWN_pronoun} might become violent.
LanguageData.CannotDisableCube: {PAWN_labelShort} refuses to deactivate the golden cube.
LanguageData.LetterGoldenCubeComa: {PAWN_labelShort}'s cube withdrawal has sent {PAWN_objective} into a coma. {PAWN_pronoun} will remain in a coma until the golden cube's psychic link has completely dissipated.
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationConfirmation: Deactivating the golden cube will cause any cube-interested people to enter a violent berserk rage. Any cube-interested people in caravans will be permanently lost.
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationConfirmationPawnsBerserk: The following people will enter a berserk rage
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationConfirmationPawnsLost: The following people will run away and be lost
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationConfirmationEnd: Are you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationBerserkDesc: {PAWN_labelShort} has successfully destroyed the golden cube. The psychic whiplash has driven colonists into a berserk rage!
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationBerserkPawns: These people have entered a temporary berserk rage
LanguageData.CubeDeactivationLostPawns: These people in caravans have run away in a rage
LanguageData.MentalBreakReason_CubeSculpting: This happened because of {PAWN_possessive} obsession with the cube.
LanguageData.MessageSlaughterNoFlesh: Cannot slaughter: {PAWN_labelShort} does not have flesh.
LanguageData.LetterObeliskDiscovered: {PAWN_nameDef} has discovered a large obelisk. It looks nearly identical to the one that originally brought {PAWN_objective} here. Perhaps it can be activated to return {PAWN_objective} home.\n\nSelect {PAWN_nameDef} and right-click the obelisk to activate it.
LanguageData.LetterFloorEtchingsRamblings: {PAWN_nameDef} has managed to decipher the floor etchings.
LanguageData.LetterLabyrinthExit: The whirring obelisk has returned your abducted colonists. Shortly after doing so, it vanished into thin air.\n\nBe careful, the obelisk may have returned other creatures as well.
LanguageData.GrayDoorJammed: Jammed shut. Must be forced open.
LanguageData.VoidMonolithInvestigatedText:
The monolith's dark metallic surface is warm to the touch, and {PAWN_nameDef} thinks {PAWN_pronoun} can hear a faint hum emanating from inside. The lines on its dusty surface seem to squirm in unsettling patterns.

{PAWN_nameDef} focuses on the shapes, trying to uncover their meaning.

The hum strengthens. The shapes begin to flow in {PAWN_nameDef}'s vision, but the surface isn't changing. Power begins to uncoil in the empty space all around. A black shape is forming in {PAWN_possessive} mind.

The Anomaly is stirring...
LanguageData.VoidMonolithRequiredEntityCategory: In order to advance the monolith to the next step, you need to discover {0} {1} tier entities.
LanguageData.VoidMonolithVisionText: {PAWN_nameDef} has had a strange dream. In it, {PAWN_pronoun} saw a black shape, unfurling in space and time, growing and consuming. The shape originated from a nearby crumbled monolith.\n\nUpon waking from the vision, {PAWN_nameDef} feels strangely drawn to the monolith. It calls to {PAWN_objective}.
LanguageData.MonolithArrivalText: Interacting with the psychic signal has caused a strange structure to appear.
LanguageData.MonolithArrivalTextExt: It is very similar, if not identical, to the monolith you previously encountered.
LanguageData.MonolithTwistingExplanation: Your presence has caused the monolith to twist and morph. Soon the process will be complete. Be prepared for whatever comes next.
LanguageData.MonolithAutoActivatingText: A wave of dread passes over your colonists. The fallen monolith has begun to stir. Slowly, it begins to twist and rearrange itself, morphing into something new.\n\nWithin a matter of days, the process will be complete. Be prepared for whatever comes next.
LanguageData.MonolithAutoActivatedText: The monolith’s transformation is almost complete...
LanguageData.LetterGrayPallDescending: A blanket of gritty fog has descended on this area. The fog smells ancient, somehow, and it stings the skin. The unnatural grayness of it invokes a sense of dread.
LanguageData.VoidAwakeningConfirmationText:
Awakening the void monolith will engulf your colony in darkness for a number of days and attract powerful entities. Make sure you are well prepared:

- Stockpile food, building material, and weapons.
- Make sure your colony is well lit, and has ample power. Avoid relying on solar generators.
- Ensure your colony is well defended, and your colonists are ready to fight.

Once you awaken the void monolith, there is no going back.

Are you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.VoidNodeLetter:
A writhing sphere of crackling psychic energy rises before {PAWN_nameDef}. Its surface swells and twists, warping the space around it.

{PAWN_nameDef} feels it inside {PAWN_possessive} mind, deeper than any normal human sense. It defeats logic and sets {PAWN_objective} adrift in the void. {PAWN_pronoun} stands on the shoreline of an infinite black ocean of power, and it beckons {PAWN_objective} in.

{PAWN_nameDef} shakes {PAWN_objective}self back to reality.

Nearby archotech devices support the sphere along fragile connections. {PAWN_nameDef} could disrupt them, closing this link between worlds and putting an end to the terrifying phenomena that have plagued your home.

Or, {PAWN_pronoun} could step into the sphere and merge with the void. It's unknown what lies beyond, or what dark powers could be gained from such an inhuman act.
LanguageData.DisruptTheLinkCredits:
The psychic flows destabilize and the archotech machinery begins to scream. The swirling void flickers. {PAWN_nameDef} feels it spilling beyond its limits and collapsing into itself, all at once.

The metallic cavern begins to twist, reshaping like the chamber of a massive heart. Before {PAWN_nameDef} has a chance to scream, {PAWN_pronoun} blinks out of existence.

{PAWN_nameDef} has rejected the void.

{PAWN_possessive} story continues...
LanguageData.EmbraceTheVoidCredits:
{PAWN_nameDef} steps into the void and the black ocean floods into {PAWN_objective}, overwhelming every sense, suffusing every cell in {PAWN_possessive} body and every thought in {PAWN_possessive} mind.

The void node has been refocused away from the world, towards one single person. The void structures scream, torn from their otherworldly foundation, then blink out of existence.

{PAWN_nameDef} has embraced the void.

{PAWN_possessive} story continues...
LanguageData.StructuresActivatedAlertDescription: Activate void structures to complete the monolith awakening.
LanguageData.GleamingMonolithInterrupted: {PAWN_nameDef}'s connection to the void monolith has been broken. It must be activated again.
LanguageData.EmergenceInDesc: Something will emerge from the ground in {0}.
LanguageData.BioferriteHarvesterEjectContentsDesc: Eject all contained {0} onto the ground.
LanguageData.BioferriteHarvesterToggleUnloadingDesc: When active, colonists will automatically unload bioferrite from the harvester as it is filling up.
LanguageData.MentalBreakReason_FrenzyInducer: This happened due to the influence of a frenzy inducer.
LanguageData.LetterChimerasAttacking: The chimeras have begun their attack!
